      • setLogDbName

        public void setLogDbName(String newLogPath)
        Sets the Log Database name, allowing overriding.
        Parameters:
        newLogPath - new log database path, to modify initial option

      • setOlDebugLevel

        public void setOlDebugLevel(String newDebugLevel)
        Sets the new debug level. A String is used because the value is initially set from a properties file Right now the valid debug levels are:
        • 0 -- internal errors are discarded
        • 1 -- Exception messages from internal errors are printed
        • 2 -- stack traces from internal errors are also printed
        Parameters:
        newDebugLevel - new debug level for any errors generated when creating log document

      • getLogSuccess

        public boolean getLogSuccess()
        Retrieve what the status of the last logging event was.
        Returns:
        success (true) or failure (false)

      • logError

        public String logError(Throwable ee)
        The basic method used to log an error. Just pass the Exception that you caught and this method collects information and saves it to the OpenLog database.
        Parameters:
        ee - Throwable to be logged
        Returns:
        the error message

      • logErrorEx

        public String logErrorEx(Throwable ee,
                String msg,
                Level severityType,
                Document doc)
        A More flexible way to send an error to the OpenLog database.
        Parameters:
        ee - Throwable to be logged
        msg - Specific error message to be logged
        severityType - Severity level, @see setSeverity(Level)
        doc - Document to be added as a link to the OpenLog document
        Returns:
        message logged in

      • logEvent

        public String logEvent(Throwable ee,
              String msg,
              Level severityType,
              Document doc)
        This method allows you to log an Event to the OpenLog database.
        Parameters:
        ee - Throwable to be logged
        msg - Specific event message to be logged
        severityType - Severity level, @see setSeverity(Level)
        doc - the doc
        Returns:
        message logged in

      • logError

        public void logError(Session s,
            Throwable ee)
        Logs an error using the passed Session.
        Parameters:
        s - Session to log the error against
        ee - Throwable to be logged

      • logError

        public void logError(Session s,
            Throwable ee,
            String message,
            Level severityType,
            Document doc)
        Logs an error with extended options using the passed Session.
        Parameters:
        s - Session to log the error against
        ee - Throwable to be logged
        message - message to be logged
        severityType - Severity level, @see setSeverity(Level)
        doc - Document to be added as a link to the OpenLog document

      • logEvent

        public void logEvent(Session s,
            Throwable ee,
            String message,
            Level severityType,
            Document doc)
        Logs an event with extended options using the passed Session.
        Parameters:
        s - Session to log the error against
        ee - Throwable to be logged
        message - message to be logged
        severityType - Severity level, @see setSeverity(Level)
        doc - Document to be added as a link to the OpenLog document

      • writeToLog

        public boolean writeToLog()
        This is the method that does the actual logging to the OpenLog database. This method creates a document in the log database, populates the fields of that document with the values in the global variables, and adds some associated information about any Document that needs to be referenced.
        Returns:
        true, if successful
